page.title: 13Belper Fire Station
page.content: {The Fire Station}moved from Strutt St.and New Rd.to its present building, on{Matlock Rd.,}in 1968. There is one full-time and ten part-time fire men at Belper.The firemen wear thick,black trousers,black leather boots,yellow helmets, made of cork, and a tunic to protect them from the heat. They train two mornings and two hours on Tuesday evening. The fire-tower is 80ft tall. There is one fire engine which cost about Â£80,000. When you dial{999}a woman answers and puts you through to the Fire Station.They do not get cats out of trees,they leave that to the RSPCA.Six men take out 1 fire engine. {Pinglewick Hamlet {Pinglewick Hamlet}is a housing estate built about 8 years ago.The houses are built close together round courtyards but are very attractive.The builders received an award for the design.
